bill_title: to exclude uninsured and underinsured motorist coverage from excess or umbrella insurance policies.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to exclude uninsured and underinsured motorist coverage from excess or umbrella insurance policies. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 58-11 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any excess or umbrella policy of insurance offered in this state is not required to provide uninsured motorist coverage pursuant to § 58-11-9 or underinsured motorist coverage pursuant to § 58-11-9.4. Section 2. That chapter 58-11 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: For the purposes of this Act, an excess or umbrella policy of insurance is a policy of insurance which does not provide primary motor vehicle insurance for liabilities arising out of the ownership, maintenance, operation, or use of a specifically identified motor vehicle. Section 3. That chapter 58-11 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: This Act may not be construed to allow insurers to exclude uninsured or underinsured motorist coverage under an existing excess or umbrella policy if the uninsured or underinsured motorist coverage is in force on the effective date of this Act unless such exclusion is requested by the insured.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to exclude uninsured and underinsured motorist coverage from excess or umbrella insurance policies. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 58-11 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any excess or umbrella policy of insurance offered in this state is not required to provide uninsured motorist coverage pursuant to § 58-11-9 or underinsured motorist coverage pursuant to § 58-11-9.4, if the excess or umbrella coverage is first offered to and rejected by the insured. Section 2. That chapter 58-11 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: For the purposes of this Act, an excess or umbrella policy of insurance is a policy of insurance which does not provide primary motor vehicle insurance for liabilities arising out of the ownership, maintenance, operation, or use of a specifically identified motor vehicle. Section 3. That chapter 58-11 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: This Act may not be construed to allow insurers to exclude uninsured or underinsured motorist coverage under an existing excess or umbrella policy if the uninsured or underinsured motorist coverage is in force on the effective date of this Act unless such excess or umbrella coverage is first offered to and rejected by the insured.
